articles.headline: Despite Global Crises, Gas Prices Slide as U.S. Election Nears
articles.snippet: Fuel prices, which had soared after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, have dropped to their lowest level since February.
articles.abstract: Fuel prices, which had soared after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, have dropped to their lowest level since February.
articles.lead_paragraph: Gasoline is approaching or has fallen below $3 a gallon in most states, returning to a national average not seen since February in one of the clearest examples of prices declining after a period of rapid inflation.

articles.headline: More Republicans Appear to Be Voting Early, Despite Trump’s Mixed Messages
articles.snippet: In 2020, Donald Trump convinced his supporters that anything but a vote cast in person on Election Day could not be trusted — and lost. In response, Republicans shifted their stance.
articles.abstract: In 2020, Donald Trump convinced his supporters that anything but a vote cast in person on Election Day could not be trusted — and lost. In response, Republicans shifted their stance.
articles.lead_paragraph: Republicans have spent months and millions of dollars on an effort to push former President Donald J. Trump’s most loyal supporters to change their minds about voting early.
articles.byline: By Kellen Browning and Benjamin Oreskes

articles.headline: Bill Gates Privately Says He Has Backed Harris With $50 Million Donation
articles.snippet: Mr. Gates said in a statement to The Times that “this election is different,” reflecting a significant change in his political strategy.
articles.abstract: Mr. Gates said in a statement to The Times that “this election is different,” reflecting a significant change in his political strategy.
articles.lead_paragraph: After decades of sitting on the sidelines of politics, Bill Gates, one of the richest people in the world, has said privately that he recently donated about $50 million to a nonprofit organization that is supporting Vice President Kamala Harris’s presidential run, according to three people briefed on the matter.

articles.headline: California Tribes May Sue Small Casinos, Putting Them in Peril
articles.snippet: A new state law allows tribes to file suit against gambling venues they don’t operate, potentially shuttering them and jeopardizing local tax revenue.
articles.abstract: A new state law allows tribes to file suit against gambling venues they don’t operate, potentially shuttering them and jeopardizing local tax revenue.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the sprawl of Los Angeles County, a handful of casinos have operated for decades.

articles.headline: Why Gender May Be the Defining Issue of the Election
articles.snippet: The issue is rarely directly addressed by either Vice President Kamala Harris or Donald Trump. But the 2024 contest is, in ways overt and subtle, a referendum on the role of women in American life.
articles.abstract: The issue is rarely directly addressed by either Vice President Kamala Harris or Donald Trump. But the 2024 contest is, in ways overt and subtle, a referendum on the role of women in American life.
articles.lead_paragraph: With less than two weeks left before Election Day, a big question is looming over the campaign for the White House, and it has nothing to do with the economy or the barrage of attacks between former President Donald J. Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris over judgment, character and mental fitness.
articles.byline: By Lisa Lerer and Katie Glueck

articles.headline: As Election Looms, Disinformation ‘Has Never Been Worse’
articles.snippet: A torrent of falsehoods, from home and abroad, have undermined what was once a shared faith in the honesty of America’s democracy.
articles.abstract: A torrent of falsehoods, from home and abroad, have undermined what was once a shared faith in the honesty of America’s democracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Democratic Party’s vice-presidential nominee has been falsely accused of sexually molesting students. The claims have been spread by a former deputy sheriff from Florida, now openly working in Moscow for Russia’s propaganda apparatus, on dozens of social media platforms and fake news outlets.

articles.headline: U.S. Says North Korean Troops Are in Russia to Aid Fight Against Ukraine
articles.snippet: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III called the situation “very, very serious,” though he said that what the soldiers were doing in Russia was “left to be seen.”
articles.abstract: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III called the situation “very, very serious,” though he said that what the soldiers were doing in Russia was “left to be seen.”
articles.lead_paragraph: North Korea has sent troops to Russia to join the fight against Ukraine, a major shift in Moscow’s effort to win the war, U.S. officials confirmed on Wednesday. Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III called the North’s presence a “very, very serious” escalation that would have ramifications in both Europe and Asia.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt, David E. Sanger and Anatoly Kurmanaev

articles.headline: In a Tight Presidential Race, Omaha Is Basking in Its Political Relevance
articles.snippet: Reliably conservative Nebraska is one of just two states that splits its Electoral College votes. That’s why its one small “blue dot” could make a difference to Vice President Kamala Harris’s campaign.
articles.abstract: Reliably conservative Nebraska is one of just two states that splits its Electoral College votes. That’s why its one small “blue dot” could make a difference to Vice President Kamala Harris’s campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: For many in Nebraska, autumn typically involves screaming at the television during Cornhusker football games, but the state’s sudden potential to swing the outcome of the super-close presidential race has given voters here something equally exciting: electoral relevance.

articles.headline: Former OpenAI Researcher Says the Company Broke Copyright Law
articles.snippet: Suchir Balaji helped gather and organize the enormous amounts of internet data used to train the startup’s ChatGPT chatbot.
articles.abstract: Suchir Balaji helped gather and organize the enormous amounts of internet data used to train the startup’s ChatGPT chatbot.
articles.lead_paragraph: Suchir Balaji spent nearly four years as an artificial intelligence researcher at OpenAI. Among other projects, he helped gather and organize the enormous amounts of internet data the company used to build its online chatbot, ChatGPT.
